meanings.definition: Not equipped with machinery or mechanical devices.
meanings.sent1: The small farm used unmechanized tools to plant the crops.
meanings.sent2: The village had an unmechanized well for drawing water.
meanings.sent3: The unmechanized lawnmower made the task of cutting the grass quite a workout.
meanings.sent4: Her unmechanized approach to cooking involved using only basic utensils.
meanings.sent5: The unmechanized bicycle required pedaling for movement.

meanings.definition: Not operated or controlled by machinery.
meanings.sent1: The traditional loom was unmechanized, requiring manual weaving.
meanings.sent2: The unmechanized clock was wound up daily to keep time.
meanings.sent3: The unmechanized elevator was a unique experience in the modern building.
meanings.sent4: Her unmechanized approach to painting involved using brushes without any mechanical assistance.
meanings.sent5: The unmechanized boat relied on oars for propulsion.

meanings.sent1: The unmechanized factory still relied on manual labor for production.
meanings.sent2: The unmechanized printing press required hand-operated presses.
meanings.sent3: The unmechanized carriages in the historical parade added a charming touch.
meanings.sent4: Her unmechanized approach to writing involved pen and paper instead of a computer.
meanings.sent5: The unmechanized assembly line required workers to move parts manually.
